intro: Ipomoea suburceolata, commonly known as the silky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking violet to purple flowers with a velvety texture. The plant features heart-shaped leaves covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in warm climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The flowers bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
